alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 7:36PM MDT until April 18 at 1:30AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... Elm River at Westport affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm River at Westport. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The county road east of Westport becomes impassable At 14.5 feet, The bridge northwest of Kruse Dam will be overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Sunday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued late Monday night by 230 AM CDT.
